column5: Just looking for some advice or info. I Will likely be going to see my parents  this weekend, they are docking at Toronto Island for Sat night, and was wondering if it is worth taking gear as I will be visiting them Sat. and Sun. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks Jeff

Take your stuff for sure! There should be some pike, bass and carp around for sure. There are big bass that hang out under teh docks.  Heres some info from my trips to Toronto Islands - http://www.fishingfury.com/categories/plac...oronto-islands/
Mepps I think I've seen you at Toronto Island before...I'm sure it was you
I only went once last year, but in 2005 and 2004 I was there constantly - you look familiar!

This time it's very heard to catch pike and trout. I went to my company's summer event on island yestersay. After picnic, I hit and fished in my spots for a few hours. Water is very dirty.  Caught a big ugly bowfin.  Saw a couple of good size bass and carp around, alot f sunfish plus catfish. Didn't bring live bait. It works much better.

I actually caught my personal best pike out there yesterday and saw many others cruising around. So they're definitely around. Happy hour for pike, for whatever reason, tends to be around 11:00 AM. Report soon to follow...
Thanks for the replys fellas.  Just headin down now and will post any good results when i get back.  Congrats on your PB Billy! Have a good weekend all! Jeff
